title: Build a Better Data Linter with DataProofer
notes:
To download and get Dataproofer started as a Desktop app, go to http://dataproofer.org/ and download the application for your operating system.

To use Dataproofer on the command line, open up a terminal window and type `npm install -g dataproofer`

Having issues? Raise your hand and we'll work on them, or leave a note!
https://github.com/dataproofer/Dataproofer/issues

handy github repo for dataproofer:
https://github.com/dataproofer/Dataproofer

moment is the library used to parse a date
http://momentjs.com

### Common default dates for things like Excel or Mac Excel

01.01.1900 - Excel
01.01.1904 - Excel for Mac

## For org specific variants

You can pull in your own sets of tests like a normal npm project, creating new instances of a `DataProoferTest()`

Contact:
    gerald.a.rich@gmail.com
    dataproofer@dataproofer.org
    @dataproofer

### Questions about data proofer and the text exercise:
    
- how would would you share your tests and validators
- can you check zipcodes against a whitelist in dataproofer?
	- Do US zipcodes have a set format that must conform to, like UK postcodes?
		- (this was answered. thanks!)
